docs.snippet: Active steps were undertaken here today to sound out Latin-American sentiment on the question of mediation of the boundary dispute between Peru and Ecuador, the last remaining border controversy in the Western Hemisphere.

headline.main: HULL TAKES STEPS ON. MEDIATION ISSUE; Latin-American Sentiment to Be Sounded Out on PeruEcuador Controversy ENVOYS CALL ON WELLES American Republics Anxious to See Last Border Dispute on Continent Settled No Announcement Made Peru's Situation Embarrassing

docs.snippet: In the absence of any official reaction from the other governments concerned, the State Department marked time today in its consideration of Ecuador's proposal for mediation in the boundary dispute with Peru. Jose Richling, the Uruguayan Minister,...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the absence of any official reaction from the other governments concerned, the State Department marked time today in its consideration of Ecuador's proposal for mediation in the boundary dispute with Peru. Jose Richling, the Uruguayan Minister, called on Under-Secretary of State Sumner Welles for a general discussion of the proposal.
docs.abstract: U S considers proposal; Welles conf with Uruguayan and Peruvian envoys

docs.snippet: With today's dispersal of the Arbitral College of the Chaco and the announcement of plans for reopening their legations at Asuncion and La Paz, Bolivia and Paraguay began preparing today to resume normal relations, interrupted ten years ago.
